title: Erin Molan and Andrew Johns BOTH front Nine's NRL Grand Final coverage but kept separate amid feud
text:
The 2019 NRL telecast opened with NRL Immortal Andrew Johns on the panel but Erin Molan was conspicuously missing amidst the pair's reported feud.

Instead Molan was a good distance from Johns, riding the sideline with Broncos legend Darren Lockyer before he left for locker room interviews.

It will be the first time both Johns and Molan have worked the same telecast in the weeks since news broke of a feud between the two made headlines.

The 2019 NRL telecast opened with NRL Immortal Andrew Johns (right) on the panel but Erin Molan was conspicuously missing amidst the pair's reported feud

Johns told Channel 9 sport bosses months ago he no longer wanted to share a studio with Molan and he still felt the same way leading into the finals.

'He just doesn't like working with her,' a television source told Daily Mail Australia.

That source said Johns' biggest gripes were that Molan giggled and spoke over him and other Nine personalities when they were talking about football.

It was announced in the lead up to the grand final both Johns and Molan would be part of the Nine commentary team.

Another source close to Johns said he did not know when the problems between the pair began but the footballing great would not be backing down.

Instead of working the panel Erin Molan (pictured) was a good distance from Johns, riding the sideline with Broncos legend Darren Lockyer before he left for locker room interviews

'Joey is a stubborn bastard,' the source said. 'If somewhere along the line she's p***ed him off he'll probably carry it around for the rest of his life.'

Daily Mail Australia understands Johns point-blank refused requests by the Nine publicity department to put his name to gushing statements supporting Molan.

He also told the network he would not pretend he had no problem with her.

Johns has been frustrated that Nine executives were unwilling during the NRL season to address his concerns about Molan, the first source said.

The feud is now threatening to overshadow the network's Grand Final coverage.

Nine has confirmed Johns and Molan will both feature as usual in Sunday's broadcast, with all parties publicly pretending there is no rift between the pair.

Molan has borne the brunt of the backlash from fans who sided with Johns as a rugby league Immortal.

Erin Molan and Andrew John's feud will come to a head when they work alongside each other at Sunday night's NRL Grand Final

She had to endure vicious online attacks including death threats and other abuse sent to her.

'I had a rough night. I didn't sleep very well,' Molan said when appearing on radio on Thursday.

Former NRL star-turned media personality Beau Ryan said Molan had been left 'broken' by years of abuse on social media and he could not speak highly enough of the way she continued to front the cameras.

Legendary NRL commentator Ray Warren also defended Molan's ability and the need for more women in broadcasting

Hours before he calls his 43rd NRL Grand Final alongside the warring pair on Sunday night, the Hall of Fame broadcaster said he was disappointed with how the feud was handled.

Johns told Channel 9 sport bosses months ago he no longer wanted to share a studio with Molan and he still felt the same way

Nine has confirmed Johns and Molan will both feature as usual in Sunday's broadcast, with all parties publicly pretending there is no rift between the pair

'I'm friends with both and rate them very highly. I'm surprised and a bit disappointed how it's played out all week,' he told the Daily Telegraph.

'Some of the ex-players are old school and they mightn't have the discretion that they should have.

Legendary NRL commentator Ray Warren says he is disappointed by how badly the feud has been handled

'It could have been handled differently. Giving women an equal opportunity in the media, politics and everything is important, and Erin is very good at her job.

Erin Molan has expressed her excitement as former NRLW superstar Ruan Sims joining the Nine commentary team after she announced her retirement from rugby league.

The Jillaroos and Rooster captain announced her retirement in September after helping see in the inaugural NRLW season in 2018.

Sims joined the nine commentary team for Sunday's telecast as one of the lead announcers for the NRLW final between the Broncos and the Dragons.

Appearing on the Sunday Footy Show Molan was full of praise for the trailblazing female rugby league star,

'I’m just glad now we get more access to you in commentary so that’ll be brilliant,' Molan said of Sims joining the team.

'I have no doubt you would not be sitting here today to talk about the NRLW grand final on grand final day if it hadn't been for all the work you have done, you have been an incredible ambassador for the game both on the field and off it.'

Molan helped steer the telecast before cutting to the NSW State Championship between the Jets and the Bears amidst a bitter feud with rugby league Immortal Andrew Johns.

authors: Adam Mccleery For Daily Mail Australia
